Detailed Description

This class is a base class for different directions of descent implemented in path-based algorithms.

Direction of descent is in the space of path flows. It is expected that only one instance of derived classes will be allocated and used. DescDirectionPathScaled is a friend class because it calls createPathDirection() on the pointer passed to it.

Member Function Documentation

PathAndDirection** DescDirectionPath::calculatePathDirection ( int &  size,
const std::list< Path * > &  paths,
bool &  isEquilibrated 
)
inline

Deallocates memory used by a previously calculated direction of descent (represented by class PathAndDirection), creates a new one and returns it.

Parameters
sizeafter calling this function it will contain the size of the allocated array with path-based direction of descent.
pathsthe list of paths currently stored in a given O-D set.
isEquilibratedafter calling this function it will contain true if the current O-D set is equilibrated (the notion of being equilibrated depends on the algorithm, but basically it means that it is either useless or impossible to shift flows within given O-D set), false otherwise.
virtual PathAndDirection** DescDirectionPath::createPathDirection ( int &  size,
const std::list< Path * > &  paths,
bool &  isEquilibrated 
)
protectedpure virtual

This method is responsible for creation of direction of descent. It depends on a particular path-based algorithm.

Implemented in DescDirectionPathScaled, DescDirectionPathISP, DescDirectionPathPG, DescDirectionPathGP, and DescDirectionPathPE.

Path *  minPath 
) const
inlineprotected
Returns
path with maximal cost within the set of given paths. It also ensures that it does not coincide with the path with minimal cost.
